Bookmark it! ## Textbook (Really?!) :::: r-stack ![](./images/01-syllabus/read1.png){.fragment width="1800" height="1000"} ![](./images/01-syllabus/read2.png){.fragment width="1600" height="900"} ![](./images/01-syllabus/read3.png){.fragment width="1400" height="400"} ![](./images/01-syllabus/read4.png){.fragment width="1200" height="800"} :::: ## Textbook (Dr. Yu's Online Book) - [*Introduction to Statistics*](https://chenghanyu-introstatsbook.netlify.app/), by Cheng-Han Yu - Full detailed explanation of course slides üòé ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} [![](./images/01-syllabus/IS.png){fig-align='center' width=60%}](https://chenghanyu-introstatsbook.netlify.app/) ::: ::: ## Learning Management System (D2L) ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](./images/01-syllabus/d2l_f25.png){fig-align='center' width=100%} ::: ::: - Submit your work: **Assessments > Dropbox** - Check your grade: **Assessments > Grades** - New announcement: **News** ## Grading Policy ✨ - Your final grade is earned out of **[1000]{.red} total points** distributed as follows: - **Homework 1 to 8: [175]{.red} pts (25 pts each)** - **Quiz 1 to 4: [200]{.red} pts (50 pts each)** - **Exam 1 and 2: [300]{.red} pts (150 pts each)** - **Final exam: [150]{.red} pts** - **AI Project: [150]{.red} pts** - **Class participation: [25]{.red} pts** - ‚ùå No extra credit projects/homework/exam to compensate for a poor grade. - Individual grade will **NOT** be curved. ## Grade-Percentage Conversion ✨ - Your final grade is based on your percentage of points earned out of 1000 points. - $[x, y)$ means greater than or equal to $x$ and less than $y$. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}

````` ::: ::: ## Homework (175 pts) - **Assessments > Dropbox** and upload your homework in **PDF** format. - There are 8 homework sets. - You must submit YOUR OWN work. üôè - Every homework is due by **Friday 11:59 PM ** (**Don't miss it. This is a hard deadline**‚ùó). - MSSC 5720 students may have more or different homework questions. - ‚ùå **No make-up homework**. - The lowest score will not be in your final grade calculation. - Using generative AI (GenAI) tools is allowed, but you **must carefully cite it or reveal your use of AI.** ## Quizzes (200 pts) - There are 4 in-class 15-min quizzes. - üìö Quizzes are individual and in **closed-book** and **no-tech** format, except a calculator. - ‚ùå No cheat sheet or GenAI is allowed. - ‚ùå **No make-up quizzes** for any reason unless you got an [excused absence](https://bulletin.marquette.edu/policies/attendance/undergraduate/). Check the [syllabus](https://math4720-f25.github.io/website/course-syllabus.html#quizzes) for more details. ## Exams (450 pts) - There are **two** midterm exams and **one** final exam. - The midterms have *in-class* and *take-home* parts, and the final is a in-class written exam. - üìÑ For the in-class parts, one piece of **letter size** cheat sheet is allowed. It has to be turned-in with your exam. - For the take-home parts, you are allowed to use GenAI tools. However, you **must carefully cite it or reveal your use of AI.** . . . - **Assessments > Dropbox** to submit your take-home exams in **PDF** format. - Exam 1 covers Week **1 to 6**. - Exam 2 covers Week **7 to 11**. - Final exam is comprehensive and covers the **all course materials**. üòé - ‚ùå **No make-up exams** for any reason unless you got an [excused absence](https://bulletin.marquette.edu/policies/attendance/undergraduate/). ## AI Project (150 pts) - There will be one AI project released around Week 13. - You have to use GenAI to self learn a topic that is not covered in my lectures, and generate a data analysis report. - The project topic will also be tested in the final exam. - You **must carefully cite your GenAI tool or reveal your use of AI.** ## What Computing Language We Use (I Teach)? ::::: {.columns} :::: {.column width="50%"} - üìà The best language for statistical computing! - ‚úÖ You may use other tools or software such as Excel, Python, Minitab, etc to do your work, but I will **NOT** teach any of them. - ‚ùå Drop/Swap deadline: **09/02/2025**. Don't miss it! :::: :::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} [![](./images/01-syllabus/Rlogo.png){fig-align='center' width=100%}]() ::: ::: :::: ::::: ## Document Generative AI Use :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="80%"} - You may use generative AI tools such as ChatGPT and Gemini to generate a first draft of text for your work, provided that this use is **documented and cited**. - Unless explicitly stated otherwise, you may make use of any online resources, but you must **explicitly cite/document** where you obtained any code you directly use or use as inspiration in your solutions. ::: ::: {.column width="20%"} ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/01-syllabus/genai.png){fig-align='center' width=80%} ::: ::: ::: :::: - If you use GenAI, please include the followings in your submitted work: + **Why/How I used AI (prompts or questions)** + **Generated output (screenshot or copy-paste excerpt)** + **How I used the output** ## Document Generative AI Use - **Why/How I used AI (prompts and questions)** + *I asked ChatGPT to generate a histogram using R.* - **Generated output (screenshot or copy-paste excerpt)** ::: tiny ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/01-syllabus/genai_screenshot.png){fig-align='center' width=35%} ::: ::: ::: - **How I used the output** + *I reviewed the suggestions, but I did not use the exact code. <script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
